pros: Clear direction with clear goals, great people working hard to deliver for the learners. College working hard to look after the wellbeing of colleagues and ensure they have the right tools to do the job. The future is looking very good for everyone at the college. Strong CEO and team.
cons: Just need to keep working on the comms to ensure everyone gets the same clear messages.

review_title: A great place to work , great people
pros: I have been employed at The college for some 15 years , we have had ups and downs within this time , with mergers , changes of executive teams, however the college has come through the other side , its a great place to work , where I feel we are now getting it right with care of staff , great promotion prospects if you feel you want to aim higher , professional development , and a fair and transparent pay scale . The holiday & other welfare packages that all add to a good work / life balance is better than most other organisations , opportunity to purchase additional holiday etc . I have worked , and work with a great bunch of people here who all realise the importance of educating the learners of Nottingham and how important it is for the future of our City …and the region , the whole point of working in an education establishment is to educate and everyone who works in our organisation prioritises that. Communication lines are improving so everyone has a voice . Have a great mix of people working here from all walks of life
cons: Communication lines were poor , although improving rapidly. Pay and recognition was poor and is now being rectified .

review_title: Not as Good as they would like you to think
pros: Sports courses attached to local teams. New T Level courses. Teacher training is part of the role. Flexible working.
cons: Some campus leads spend more time showing off that they are the ‘’boss’, than actually doing the job. Courses with animals need better facilities and staffing. Mental health support is minimal and the award they received was not deserved. A lot of effort went in to stopping Ofsted from seeing all the bad things the college doesn’t want them to see. Some members of staff misuse the flexible working arrangements. Management bullying staff in every department they are moved to.

pros: Lots of opportunities to develop and progress. Supportive space with a range of wellbeing routes. Friendly, welcoming people who work together to help people get to wherever they want to be.
cons: On a journey - lots of great stuff achieved, more to come.

pros: Supportive, caring, some progression and make great friends
cons: Pay is not enough, could be better for cost of living

pros: No more pros than any other College
cons: The new CEO has been brought in to merge Nottingham College and Derby College. Don't believe all the hype around her, she isn't any different to other CEOs and Principals. It's all about money and take time to look where she came from and what happened there.

cons:

review_title: College needs to start all over again!
job_title: Student Services Advisor in Nottingham, England
pros: Some lovely and caring staff and the progress of students was a joy to watch and be a part off.
cons:
- Poor Salary.
- Bad management.
- Departments are poorly underfunded.
- Staff drama is too much in some departments.
- Not enough care taking into complaints and investigations.
- Understaffed.
- Not enough done about misbehaving students and safety of students. 
- Some staff are poorly trained and inexperienced ( which can be a nightmare to work and deal with ).
- Poor communication between staff members and departments.

pros: Great colleagues, passionate staff, great students
cons: Poor management, lack of communication and no clear progression.

job_title: Course Leader and Lecturer in Nottingham, England
pros: Rewarding, autonomy, creativity, responsibility, 5 weeks holiday, entertaining. The reward of helping young people develop and grow as people and become young adults is extremely satisfying
cons: Reducing the intricacies of each individual students circimstances to data, and being assessed on targets based on a national average. The increase in workload, paperwork that proves you can do the job that takes so long to do you don't actually have the time to do the job to the level you have evidence that says you can. Management that that have never taught that turn education into a capitalist enterprise where the main aim is to make profit. The illusion that this is all somehow beneficial to the student and prepares them for the reality of a commercialised business printed world. The lack of funding, frozen salaries, increase in teaching hours. How English and Maths is now our responsibility, yet a real terms pay cut.

pros:
- Excellent colleagues
- Challenging course material
- Motivated, inspired students
- An exciting city to work in with very good public transport systems (e.g. train routes, trams, buses)
cons:
- Overworked and underpaid
- A definite leaning towards zero-hour (hourly paid) contracts
- Only recognise 2 teaching unions
- Make sure you join a union (UCU is the most popular one)

review_title: Unrealistic expectations given hours of work
pros: The students are the best, and you make a real difference in people's lives
cons: Expect to work outside your contracted hours

pros: Friendly staff and students who want to learn.
cons: Variable hour contracts and low pay.
